1. Rotate the device screen to the orientation you want.

2. Hit the Floating button below to lock your screen orientation.

3. Hit the Floating button again to unlock your screen orientation.

4. On Nougat, you have a QS tile for quick access.

You\'ll need to open the app, rotate your screen to the orientation you need (mostly landscape), then hit the floating button to lock the orientation, then go back to your app or home screen to launch the other app you want to launch. Please note that if your launcher requests portrait orientation then the screen will rotate back to portrait mode. After you open the other app, the screen will go right back to the landscape/portrait mode you expect.
\nOn Android 7 Nougat and later, you also have a QuickSetting Tile that acts similar the built-in Tile. However, my QS Tile can lock the device orientation to the current one. For example, the screen is in landscape mode, you pull down the QS panel, hit my QS Tile and the orientation will be locked to landscape. So you don\'t have to open the app to perform orientation lock.
